comments: Have to say that his problems sets really takes time. Fortunately, his exam questions are straightforward and easy. He explains econometric concepts clearly in class and his three TAs are all very helpful during their discussion sessions and office hours.

HORRIBLE. Without a doubt the worst lecturer I\'ve ever had, can\'t even explain the simplest of ideas without stumbling all over himself and completely missing the point. Can\'t teach to save his life. Was also very rude the one time I dared to ask a question.

Terrible lecturer. Stumbles over himself the entire time, focusing on trivial concepts, neglecting the bigger ones. I wasn\'t looking forward to taking 55, and he didn\'t make it any better. Stay far, far away, unless you want to teach yourself.
incompetent professor. course material is challenging enough and Hotz\'s teaching is one more obstacle to have to overcome. DO NOT TAKE

Horrible lecturer, doesn\'t know how to explain concepts. Constantly made mistakes while he was speaking, and students often corrected him during class. I basically had to teach myself. Test wasn\'t too bad though, he definitely could have made it harder.

Couldn\'t understand what he was explaining and he often made mistakes himself in what he was teaching in class. Doesnt seem to care how well his students do in the class; it was a rough transition from 51 with Leachman, who at least taught everything on the tests and was there to help, despite being a hard grader.
Bad lecturer and assumes that we understand the difficult concepts. No wonder the course has two teachers
He dotes on inconsequential concepts, but assumes that we understand the harder concepts, which he conveniently forgets to teach
He\'s so bad at lecturing... No body pays attention in class at all.
